TopicTitle: Post your terrible, but cool looking rockets/planes

Articles.Content:
Now for those sandbox players who want to make absolutely anything and everything, we're not exactly BAD at the game, but from time to time, design completely overtakes function and we end up with the coolest looking thing that flies like a milk truck with wings.

I still sometimes make things that ARE very functional and do look good at the same time, but this is a thread for the hopeless creations

Here's a thread to post em

Here's my SR-71 cousin.

Flying Starfish (Flies upside-down)

I have a few:

I tried to make cool looking planes...

This thing flies like a brick.

And my Space Shuttle is a horrible glider.

I built a Gloster Meteor a little while ago:

...It didn't go very well.

Then there was this Fairey Swordfish:

It is horribly unbalanced and ridiculously difficult to fly. But it looks nice

This is OCS3. It's been succeeded by the nth iteration of OCS4, which flies very well but comparatively looks boring.

It didn't fly very well because of the angled wings, which was largely an aesthetic feature.

With them being angled how they were, it had very little lift and would drop like a stone once its velocity fell below 150m/s.

The double rudders and cambered landing gear were also interfering design choices which were largely aesthetic.

Edited May 19, 2014 by Blue

Originally began as an effort for a light eve lander under 20t, but I became sidetracked in keeping the ascetics while remaining under 20 tons so far unsuccessful.

http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/486698014795974839/6DBCACE5D10507F342C677F12F49F5FCBD1E0D34/

Originally began as an effort for a light eve lander under 20t, but I became sidetracked in keeping the ascetics while remaining under 20 tons so far unsuccessful.

http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/486698014795974839/6DBCACE5D10507F342C677F12F49F5FCBD1E0D34/

http://cloud-3.steampowered.com/ugc/486698014785891327/634BA2F1526BC374A22C504EF47038746872E4EE/

http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/486698014795282758/64554025BCB95C9A0020EC0941FBF15D60F0D32C/

Fly like hell or not, did that actually work?

It flies fine, the problem is keeping the tonnage below 20t while keeping enough dV for a high altitude EVE launch while also keeping the Taurus shape. Anything below 34ish tons and it begins to look more like a typical EVE lander kludge than a "clean" craft. Still a work in progress.

Here's my badass cargo helicopter, for transporting equally badass stuff.

Needless to say, I'm a terrible pilot and almost always manage to **** things up.

I also tried developing my own shuttle before giving up and downloading Giggleplex's.

My MULE project was a... complete disaster.

Although a subsequent version actually made it to the Mun. Doesn't he look happy?

And here's a re-supply aircraft carrying two rovers, a transmitter, and a lighting system to my polar base.
I've got far to many to post here!
Tried a SR-71 Blackbird replica a while ago, but it ended up too structurally unstable and it just spins out of control. Ain't that cool really.

Here are my glorious contraptions.

Mun Tank (literally)......and yes it actually landed on the Mun.

Edited May 22, 2014 by Tommygun

Sigh... My failed project N1L3 Lunar Rocket. I gave up hope when this thing hit +1100 parts and reduced my frame rate to about 6 fps. This thing also went out of control when Block A (the 1st stage) ran out of fuel, even with mechjeb. I might revive this rocket... maybe...

I only have two craft that I had to ask Ferram about....

SVO-11 and SVO-12.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

And then this one... which worked great till I got it all the way to Ike and realized that its drills were to short to reach the ground with the nose gear deployed.....
